column5: Would this be a problem? Does anyone know if there is a problem when a person moves in the U.S. to a different state after acquiring his passport and gets a new drivers license for that state. Didn't know if a change of address would matter. bigdog
I don't think it should be a problem. My passport doesn't have an address on it. Just Nationality: United States of America and Place of Birth: Minnesota.
Last year all we needed at either border was our passports.

You will have no issue. The passport doesnt require one to renew after a change of address even if you change States. It has no information about your current address as the other posters have stated. If it make you feel better I have been all over Europe with a passport issued in a diffrent state then I was currently living. No issues.
